intro: Ageratina rhodopappa f. rhodopappa, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, velvety texture.
